title: China’s Short-End Bonds Rally Amid Debate on Likely PBOC Trading
content: China’s short-end sovereign bonds rallied as heavy purchases by state banks spurred a debate among traders on whether the central bank was behind the move.

title: FTSE 100 Live: London’s Stock Market Set to Lose Another Tech Firm
JSDA Said to Probe Brokerages on Unsuitable Japanese Bond Sales
content: A Japanese securities industry group is probing brokerages on inappropriate bond selling practices amid surging investor demand for higher-yielding corporate debt.

title: Global Demand Jumps for Emerging Asia Bonds on Rate-Cut Bets, FX
content: Global investors are extending their purchases of sovereign bonds in emerging Asia on rate-cut wagers and stronger local currencies.

title: Saudi Arabia’s IPO Boom Faces Multiple Challenges
content: Saudi Arabian firms have raised about $3 billion from new share sales this year, making it one of the world’s hottest IPO markets. But a series of recent setbacks is threatening to take the sheen off that boom, Bloomberg's Laura Gardner Cuesta reports on Horizons Middle East & Africa. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: OPEC+ Quota Hikes Yet to Deliver Oil Surge, Morgan Stanley Says
content: The OPEC+ alliance may be boosting oil-production quotas at a significant pace in a push to restart idled capacity, but that shift has yet to translate into big gains in actual output, according to Morgan Stanley.

title: Oil Holds Ground Ahead of Fresh Round of US-China Trade Talks
content: Oil steadied after a weekly surge as a renewed round of US-China trade talks offered the potential for reduced global tensions.

title: Chinese Defense Companies Soar as Pakistan Touts Arms Purchase
content: Shares of Chinese defense companies rallied Monday, after Pakistan said it intends to buy one of the Asian power’s most-advanced fighter jets as a part of major arms purchase.

title: Chinese Stocks in Hong Kong Head for Bull Market Before US Talks
content: Chinese shares trading in Hong Kong were on course to enter a bull market by Monday’s close, as planned talks between the US and China fuel a wider sense of relief among investors.

title: China Soy Imports at Record as US Spat Spurs More Brazil Flows
content: China’s soybean imports climbed to an all-time high last month as the world’s biggest buyer scooped up large volumes mainly from Brazil amid concerns that its trade war with the US could boost global prices.

title: US-China Trade Talks; LA Immigration Clashes Escalate | Horizons Middle East & Africa 6/9/2025
content: The US and China are ready to resume trade talks in London today... with the flow of rare earth minerals set to be a key focus; clashes between law enforcement and demonstrators in Los Angeles over anti-deportation protests escalate. President Trump's deployment of the National Guard inflames residents... California's Governor says he will file a law suit to block the federal government's intervention; and Bloomberg learns Meta is in talks to invest in startup Scale AI. The financing may exceed $10 billion, making it one of the largest-ever private company funding deals. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Sunnova Files for Bankruptcy Amid Rooftop Solar Struggles
content: Sunnova Energy International Inc., one of the largest US rooftop solar companies, filed for bankruptcy in Texas following struggles with mounting debt and diminishing sales prospects.

title: In Upside-Down Bond Market, Italy and Greece Are the Big Winners
content: As fiscal-deficit concerns rocked global bond markets last month, an unusual thing happened. The bonds of Italy, Greece and Spain rallied.

title: Stocks Rise Before China-US Talks, Dollar Dips: Markets Wrap
content: Asian stocks rose ahead of trade talks between China and the US Monday that have the potential to cool tensions between the world’s two largest economies.

title: Gold Steadies After Two-Day Loss Ahead of US-China Trade Talks
content: Gold steadied — after losing almost 2% over the previous two sessions — as another round of US-China trade talks offered hope tensions between the two largest economies can be eased.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/09/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and Stephen Engle give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/9/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 9/6/25
content:
"Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets.

Note: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said in a post on X that Marines could be sent next if protests intensify in California. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Data Still Don't Make Anything Easy for the Fed
content: Reduced risk of a recession gives little reason to cut rates.

title: China’s Rare Earth Exports Recover Ahead of US Trade Talks
content: Chinese exports of rare earths, a group of 17 minerals at the center of a trade dispute with Washington, rose 23% in May from the previous month, according to customs data on Monday.

title: China’s Copper Boom Tested as Miners Wield Bargaining Power
content: The unrelenting expansion of Chinese copper processing capacity over the past few years has now become a global headache, as smelters scramble to secure the ore they need to produce the vital industrial metal.

title: ‘Most-Unloved Bonds’ Turn Routine US Auction Into Crucial Test
content: Global investor pushback against long-term government debt is turning what normally would be a routine US bond auction into one of the most anticipated events on Wall Street this week.

title: Elliott Calls for Sumitomo Realty Improvement in Rare Letter
content: Elliott Investment Management is calling for Sumitomo Realty & Development Co. to improve shareholder returns and corporate governance, saying the Japanese real estate developer’s stock is worth 40% more than its current value.

title: LA Immigration Clashes Escalate for Third Day (Correct)
content:
Demonstrations over US immigration raids intensified for a third consecutive day in the Los Angeles area, with thousands of protesters clashing with security forces outside a downtown federal detention center. Bloomberg’s Alicia Caldwell reports on the latest developments.

(Corrects headline to remove reference to Trump considering Marines deployment. The video has also been edited to remove an anchor's description of Trump's comments.) (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Julius Baer Sees Consumption Revival in India Taking Stocks to Record High
content: Julius Baer Group is expecting Indian stocks to hit a new high in the second half of the fiscal year, as domestic consumption recovers.

title: German Sovereign Bonds See Largest Japanese Selloff Since 2014
content: Japanese investors sold the largest amount of German sovereign bonds in a decade in April, the month after fiscal concerns spurred a selloff of the European nation’s debt.

title: US, China to Resume Trade Talks With Focus on Rare Earths
content: The US and China are set to resume trade negotiations in London on Monday in a bid to further defuse tensions over rare-earth minerals and advanced technology following a phone call between leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping last week.

title: Indian Central Bank's Jumbo Rate Cut Could Supercharge IPO Pipeline
content: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: Keep the Portfolio Tilt Toward Risk, Lombard Odier's Lee Says
content: Lombard Odier's Homin Lee says investors should "keep the portfolio tilt toward risk" as latest developments suggest that "we're still in the middle of the deal making phase in the Trumpian trade policy." Lee discusses his outlook for global equities on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Wall Street Touts India Options for Market Insulated From Trump
content: India’s equity rally may have stuttered recently, but Wall Street banks are now doubling down on the world’s fifth-largest stock market, this time focusing on derivatives.

title: NATO’s Rutte Calls For ‘Quantum Leap’ in Defense Investment
content: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said members of the military alliance need to deliver a “quantum leap” in their collective defense amid the ongoing threat from Russia.

title: Chinese Aircraft Carrier Seen Operating Deeper Into Pacific
content: A Chinese aircraft carrier made one of its deepest forays into the Pacific Ocean over the weekend as Beijing continues to project its military power further from its shores.

title: S. Korea’s Lee, Japan’s Ishiba Vow to Boost Ties in First Call
content: South Korea’s President Lee Jae-myung and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba held their first phone conversation and vowed to seek ways to deepen bilateral ties so both nations can respond together to future challenges.

title: LA Clashes Escalate as Trump, Newsom Spar Over National Guard
content: Tensions flared in Los Angeles on the third day of anti-deportation protests, as demonstrators clashed with law enforcement while President Donald Trump and California Governor Gavin Newsom exchanged blame over the unrest and responsibility for restoring order.

title: US, China to Resume Trade Talks With Focus on Rare Earths
content: The US and China are set to resume trade negotiations in London on Monday in a bid to further defuse tensions over rare-earth minerals and advanced technology following a phone call between leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping last week.

title: Israel Blocks Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza, Group Says
content: Israel intercepted a humanitarian aid ship trying to reach Gaza that was carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg, the group operating the vessel said.

title: Senator in Intensive Care Shows Colombia Spinning Out of Control
content: Last Thursday, presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia was fast sinking back into its violent past. Two days later, a gunman shot him in the head during a rally.

title: LA Mayor Bass Seeks Peace After Trump Calls in National Guard
content: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass called for peace as thousands of people demonstrating against immigration raids clashed with security forces for a third day.

title: Starmer Calls on Nvidia’s Huang to Train Up Britons on AI
content: Keir Starmer will make an appearance alongside Nvidia Corp co-founder Jensen Huang on Monday, as the British prime minister puts technology and artificial intelligence at the heart of his government’s plan to boost economic growth.

title: Trump Says National Guard Will Restore Order, End Unrest in LA
content: President Donald Trump pledged Sunday to send whatever is necessary to California to respond to two days of protests in Los Angeles triggered by sweeping immigration raids.

title: Italy Votes on Citizenship, Job Protections Amid Turnout Concern
content: ROME (AP) — Italians vote over two days starting Sunday in referendums that would make it easier for children born in Italy to foreigners to obtain citizenship, and on providing more job protections. But apparent low public awareness risks rendering the votes invalid if turnout is not high enough.

title: Venezuela Plans a 50% Fuel Hike as It Braces for Revenue Slump
content: Venezuela’s government is laying the groundwork for a 50% hike in fuel prices at the pump as it braces for a decrease in revenues after US oil major Chevron and other oil firms halted work in the country.

title: Renault In Discussions With France to Make Drones in Ukraine
content: French automaker Renault SA has held discussions with the French defense ministry to produce drones in Ukraine.

title: Spain Opposition Calls for Early Elections as Thousands Rally in Madrid
content: Spain’s main opposition party rallied thousands of people in a demonstration in the heart of Madrid, calling for early elections following accusations of corruption against the Socialist-led government of Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.

title: Israel Says It Recovered Body of Hamas Commander Mohammed Sinwar
content: The Israeli army on Sunday said it recovered the body of Mohammed Sinwar, a senior Hamas commander who was killed in a May 13 airstrike at a Gaza hospital.

title: Colombia Candidate Fighting for Life After Assassination Bid
content: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay remains in a critical condition after an assassination attempt on Saturday that recalled the political violence that roiled the nation in the 1980s and 1990s.

title: US Seeks Deal in London on China Rare Earth Flows, Hassett Says
content: US negotiators will aim to restore the flow of critical minerals when they meet their Chinese counterparts for a new round of trade negotiations Monday in London, a top economic aide to President Donald Trump said.

title: Israel Vows to Stop Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza
content: Israel won’t allow a humanitarian aid ship — carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg — to reach Gaza, Defense Minister Israel Katz said on Sunday.

title: Gaza Militia With Ties to Israel Emerges to Challenge Hamas
content: A Palestinian militia operating with tacit approval from Israel has surfaced in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip to challenge the rule of Hamas, which threatened a crackdown in turn.

title: Ukraine Rejects Claim Russian Forces Enter Key Central Region
content: Kyiv’s armed forces rejected as “disinformation” Russia’s claim that its ground troops have crossed into Ukraine’s Dnipropetrovsk region for the first time, even as prospects for a US-brokered ceasefire remain elusive.

title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to De-Escalate Border Standoff
content: The governments of Thailand and Cambodia agreed to de-escalate a border standoff by adjusting military forces in the conflict zone, following a skirmish in late May. The decision was announced by Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra in a post on X late Sunday.

title: Trump to Send 2,000 National Guard Troops to Calm LA Unrest
content: President Donald Trump will send the National Guard to restore order in Los Angeles in response to growing unrest over a wave of federal immigration raids.

title: Westinghouse In Talks for Role in US Nuclear Expansion Plan: FT
content: Westinghouse Electric Co. is in discussions with US officials to deploy 10 large nuclear reactors, as it seeks a role in fulfilling President Donald Trump’s ambitions to bolster America’s nuclear energy capabilities, the Financial Times reported.

title: Macron Says Subsidy for Energy Efficient Homes Should Go On
content: French President Emmanuel Macron called on his government to continue a home renovation subsidy program after the finance ministry said it would temporarily halt the grants.

title: US Trade Team Said to Extend India Stay as Talks Gather Momentum
content: A US trade team that’s currently in India for negotiations has extended its stay, according to people familiar with the matter, in a sign talks are progressing ahead of a July deadline.

title: Chad to Suspend Visas for US Citizens After Trump Travel Ban
content: N'DJAMENA, Chad (AP) — Chad's President Mahamat Idriss Deby has announced that his country will suspend the issuing of visas to U.S. citizens in response to the Trump administration’s decision to ban Chadians from visiting the United States.

title: UK Vows Due Diligence on China Embassy Amid Security Concerns
content: The UK government promised to assess any security concerns related to the construction of a Chinese embassy near the City of London, an issue that could potentially complicate trade talks with the US.

title: Labour’s Big Worry Is No One Will Feel Record Spending Surge
content: Britain’s Labour government will make an historic investment into the country’s battered public services this week — a £300 billion ($406 billion) uplift for areas such as health care, education and transport, amounting to the largest sustained funding increase since at least 2010.

title: Tusk’s Authority Takes a Hit From Nationalist Win Before Polish Confidence Vote
content: Donald Tusk’s premiership is reeling from a presidential election debacle that’s left the Polish leader diminished in the face of a resurgent nationalist opposition.

title: UK Timeline for US Deal Is Too Ambitious, Ex-Trade Adviser Says
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer would need President Donald Trump to be “extraordinarily generous” to meet his ambition of finalizing the UK-US tariff deal in two weeks, according to Britain’s former top trade negotiator.

content: Meta Platforms Inc. is in talks to make a multibillion-dollar investment into artificial intelligence startup Scale AI, according to people familiar with the matter. Scale AI uses an army of contractors to label the data that tech firms such as Meta and OpenAI use to train and improve their AI models, and helps companies make custom AI applications. Bloomberg’s Tom Mackenzie reports.

content: ByteDance Ltd., TikTok’s parent company, has been replacing US-hired staff near Seattle with managers connected to China, aiming to replicate its e-commerce success in Asia after sales fell short in America.

title: Telefonica, Masorange Said to Weigh Plans for Vodafone Spain

title: S. Korea’s Lee, Japan’s Ishiba Vow to Boost Ties in First Call
content: South Korea’s President Lee Jae-myung and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba held their first phone conversation and vowed to seek ways to deepen bilateral ties so both nations can respond together to future challenges.

content: China’s consumer deflation extended into a fourth month, as price wars intensified while a spending boost during two national holidays failed to offset the drag from weak domestic demand.

content: South Africa’s key export industries are becoming increasingly vulnerable as climate policies like cross-border carbon taxes take hold, according to a study by Net Zero Tracker.

content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said he can’t judge if interest-rate cuts are over for this year and next steps are totally open, according to an interview with Deutschlandfunk.

title: ECB’s Central Rate Scenario May Need Fine-Tuning, Escriva Says
content: The assumptions currently guiding European Central Bank monetary policy may need tweaking, according to Governing Council member Jose Luis Escriva.

content: Research into drug treatments and longer-lasting batteries will receive new funding as part of an £86 billion package for science and technology set to be announced in next week's spending review.

content: The latest interest-rate moves primes the European Central Bank to meet its medium-term inflation goal, President Christine Lagarde told television station Monaco Info.

content: Four months into the president’s second term, his policies are upending tourism worldwide.

title: How China’s Woes Resurrected the Economic Term ‘Involution’
content: Prolonged economic challenges tend to generate their own terminology. When the US struggled with low growth and below-target inflation in the years after the 2008 crisis, the oft-used phrase was “secular stagnation.” Even worse conditions in Japan gave rise to a “deflationary mindset.”

title: China Says Electric Vehicle Talks With EU Reach Final Stages

title: Austria Cut to Record Low by Fitch as Budget Woes Persist
content: Austria’s sovereign credit was cut by Fitch Ratings to two steps below the top mark for the first time, handing the recently-formed government another setback in its bid to repair the country’s finances.

title: ECB’s Vujcic Says Interest-Rate Reductions Are Nearly Done
content: The European Central Bank’s interest-rate cutting campaign is almost over, Governing Council member Boris Vujcic said.

title: Charting the Global Economy: ECB Nearing End of Rate-Cut Cycle
content: The European Central Bank is nearing the end of its campaign to lower interest rates after its eighth reduction in a year, according to ECB President Christine Lagarde.

title: Vietnam Inks Deals to Buy $3 Billion US Products Before Talks
content: Vietnamese businesses have signed 20 agreements worth about $3 billion to import more US agricultural products ahead of the third round of official negotiations set to take place next week.

title: A Major American Egg Farm Just Lost 90% of its Chickens
content: Are egg prices going up again?

title: L’Oreal to Buy Majority Stake in UK Skincare Brand Medik8
content: L’Oreal SA agreed to buy a majority stake in the UK company Medik8 as the French cosmetics group strengthens its presence in the booming skincare market.

title: Billionaire Razon Enters Philippines’ Booming Online Gambling
content: Tycoon Enrique Razon’s Bloomberry Resorts Corp. launched its online casino platform in the Philippines’ booming internet gambling sector, taking aim at market leader DigiPlus Interactive Corp.

title: 25 European Startups to Watch in 2025 That Could Change the World
content: These are the innovative European companies breaking new ground in tech this year.

title: DBS Tops $100 Billion Market Value in First for Singapore Banks
content: DBS Group Holdings Ltd. became the first bank in Singapore to top $100 billion in market value, helped by a softer US currency that amplified gains on the local stock market.

title: China’s Rare Earth Exports Recover Ahead of US Trade Talks
content: Chinese exports of rare earths, a group of 17 minerals at the center of a trade dispute with Washington, rose 23% in May from the previous month, according to customs data on Monday.

title: China’s Copper Boom Tested as Miners Wield Bargaining Power
content: The unrelenting expansion of Chinese copper processing capacity over the past few years has now become a global headache, as smelters scramble to secure the ore they need to produce the vital industrial metal.

title: Nomura to Shut Branch in China as It Scales Back Wealth Business
content: Nomura Holdings Inc. is closing one of its four branches in China, as the Japanese securities firm scales back its wealth management business in the mainland after years of losses.

title: UK Remains Europe’s Top Spot For Finance Investment, EY Says
content: The UK’s finance industry kept its lead over the rest of Europe in attracting foreign investment last year, although activity across the region slowed, according to professional services firm EY.

title: BYD Unleashes an EV Industry Reckoning That Alarms Beijing
content: The price war engulfing China’s electric vehicle industry has already sent share prices tumbling and prompted an unusual level of intervention from Beijing. The shakeout may just be getting started.

title: Goldman CIO Service Suddenly Catches On in Japan After 10 Years
content: It took a more than a decade of trying, but Goldman Sachs Group Inc. last year landed the first client for its business of helping institutions manage their money in Japan.

title: Lone Star’s Novo Banco Is Said to Get Bids From BPCE, CaixaBank
content: Lone Star’s Portuguese lender Novo Banco SA attracted two bids from French banking group BPCE and CaixaBank SA of Spain, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Venezuela Plans a 50% Fuel Hike as It Braces for Revenue Slump
content: Venezuela’s government is laying the groundwork for a 50% hike in fuel prices at the pump as it braces for a decrease in revenues after US oil major Chevron and other oil firms halted work in the country.

title: Renault In Discussions With France to Make Drones in Ukraine
content: French automaker Renault SA has held discussions with the French defense ministry to produce drones in Ukraine.

title: China Says Electric Vehicle Talks With EU Reach Final Stages
content: China’s commerce ministry said talks with the European Union on setting minimum prices for Chinese-made electric vehicles have “entered final stages,” although more work is required to reach a deal.

title: UK’s Visa Crackdown Leaves City of London Immigrants in Limbo
content: One banker in the City of London is faced with paying an extra £40,000 a year in university fees for his children. Nursing homes are worried about finding enough caretakers for residents. The insurance industry says overseas relocations have now ground to a halt.

title: Lilly’s Obesity Drug Sales Rise 60% in India Amid Rising Demand
content: Eli Lilly & Co. increased sales of weight-loss and diabetes drug Mounjaro 60% in India in May from April in its second full month of being on offer in the South Asian country, which has the world’s third-highest number of obese people.
